text:
looks like we officially found the single greatest use case of ai.
nope it's not optimizing workflows, starting [ENTITY] companies, or even no-code tools.
it's a fake granny spamming scammers.
i stumbled across this video of an [LOCATION]-generated grandma absolutely destroying scam callers and nearly spit out my coffee laughing.
we're all out here trying to build the next big AI startup while grandma is over there putting her digital foot down on people trying to steal her imaginary retirement fund.
this is the kind of chaotic energy we need more of in the tech world.
imagine the possibilities... AI grandmas protecting real grandmas from tech scams? it's like digital karma in the most beautiful way.
hope everyone has a great day, especially ai granny.
üé• [PERSON]

good morning, you delightful weirdos of [LOCATION]. üëã
on a platform full of try-hards, I‚Äôm on a search for the biggest, boldest, most unhinged weirdos.
The brave pioneers who refuse to conform to the ‚Äúprofessionalism‚Äù of [ORG] and instead inject their real, raw, and completely unfiltered personality.
Oh, and memes. Lots of memes.
With more ChatGPT-generated garbage flooding our feeds, the only way to stand out is by being extra human. Weird wins.
So far, I‚Äôve got [PERSON] [PERSON] at the top of my list.
But I need more test subjects for my ongoing experiment in becoming unhinged on [LOCATION].
Who‚Äôs the weirdest, most unapologetically authentic person you know on this side of the internet?
tag them below. üëá

[ENTITY], i was fired from my role at beehiiv.
and to be honest‚Ä¶ i‚Äôm relieved.
not because i didn‚Äôt love the role. i did. i‚Äôve got nothing but respect for the beehiiv team and truly believe in the product. my time there was meaningful and full of learning.
but i‚Äôm relieved because, deep down, i‚Äôve spent [ENTITY] at both ramp and beehiiv convincing myself i‚Äôd return to the founder seat someday.
and in the process, i kept putting off what i love most: building.
now, i believe this is g-d giving me a clear signal. the time is now.
so what‚Äôs next?
b2b saas: i‚Äôve already started working on a new saas product (yes, it‚Äôs related to linkedin [PERSON]).
the goal is to launch in [ENTITY] to [ENTITY] to [ENTITY] businesses, gather feedback, and scale quickly from there.
the front end is built, and now i‚Äôm looking to partner with automation engineers or developers to help on the scraping and backend side.
ghostwriting for founders: to generate some near-term cash flow, i‚Äôll be working with a select few founders on building their personal brand through linkedin and newsletters.
if you‚Äôre looking to build in public but don‚Äôt know where to start, let‚Äôs chat.
building in public: i‚Äôll be documenting the entire journey. the wins, the setbacks, the real-time lessons. [ENTITY]. also have my linkedin hunger games to keep track of!
always remember: there‚Äôs a positive in every situation.
for me, this marks the beginning of a new chapter. entrepreneurship.
my goal is to never have to work for a company again.
let‚Äôs build!
[PERSON] ill be documenting my whole journey here, [LINK]

some of us treat linkedin like a networking event while others treat it like a game of hide and seek.
not sharing your personal and professional journey on [ORG] is akin to some of these hiding spots, like hiding in a secret door or even a hidden underground garage.
i see so many brilliant entrepreneurs playing the world's greatest game of hide and seek with their audience.
now more than ever, people care more about you and your story than your fancy tech stack and your brand's mission statement.
i've talked with [ENTITY] of founders who finally stopped hiding and embraced building in public. the ones who share their journey through consistent linkedin posts and newsletters are connecting with customers, users, and investors at [ENTITY] the speed.
the best founders aren't hiding in walls, they're standing on them, waving their arms, and saying "hey, this is what we're building!". they are getting dms and email replies [ENTITY] that lead to real quantifiable opportunities and revenue.
i'm looking to help [ENTITY] founder come out of hiding with some linkedin + newsletter magic. know someone who needs this? tag them below and let‚Äôs stop playing hide and seek.
p.s. for those ready to stop hiding, the linkedin hunger games ([ENTITY] posting challenge with a twist) has [ENTITY]+ participants and [ENTITY] in the pot. slide into my dms to join the party.
[PERSON]: [HANDLE]

does anyone listen to airport announcements anymore?
sitting in an airport as im writing this and i cannot wait to return home.
see you soon, [PRODUCT]üá±

Well, it's official... I've found the fun side of [LOCATION].
[ENTITY], I put out a call to find the weirdos on this platform...
[ENTITY] nominations later, I now realize I wildly underestimated just how many of you exist.
Not to mention all the self-proclaimed weirdos sliding into my DMs.
You all are even weirder than I thought possible‚Äîand I mean that as the highest compliment.
The status quo of [LOCATION] is changing rapidly.
Over [ENTITY], I'll be sharing:
My best insights from this weird and wonderful corner of the platform
The funniest moments that had me literally laughing at my desk
The most unhinged (yet somehow still appropriate) behavior that proves authenticity wins
connect with me to be a part of the revolution ü§ù
LinkedIn doesn‚Äôt have to be boring corporate speak and [LOCATION]-generated platitudes.
Let‚Äôs have ourselves [ENTITY]. likelovecelebrate

sometimes our most firmly held beliefs get flipped upside down.
i just watched a turtle break the sound barrier to obliterate a crab in [ENTITY].
my entire childhood was a lie. turtles aren't slow ‚Äì they're strategic assassins playing the long game.
this got me thinking about another "common wisdom" myth we've all heard: email is dying in the social media era.
plot twist: email is thriving more than ever.
be honest with me... how many times have you checked your inbox [ENTITY]? how many email addresses are you actively juggling?
exactly.
email isn't just surviving, it's the backbone of our digital lives. while we're all doom-scrolling on social, our inboxes keep filling up with the stuff that actually matters.
speaking of email dominance, massive shoutout to our beehiiv squad for crushing it and officially hitting $[ENTITY]M ARR :)
turns out turtles and email have something in common ‚Äì they're both deceptively powerful and here for the long haul.

apparently we've all been handling bugs wrong our entire lives...
officially a month into building [ORG] and i'm realizing [ENTITY] trait every early-stage founder needs:
the ability to solve problems in completely unexpected and creative ways.
everyone's out here with bug spray and fancy zappers. meanwhile this person just holds up their chameleon and lets nature do its thing.
that's exactly what im trying to do with employee advocacy.
legacy platforms are trying to force the issue with corporate tools and top-down mandates.
rallyup is the chameleon. natural, effective, and actually kinda fun to watch.
the best solutions are often the ones nobody sees coming.
who else is solving old problems in weird new ways?

so, I accidentally started a revolution on linkedin.
and [ENTITY] is the day I am launching it to the public, buckle up.
but [ENTITY] story time:
[ENTITY] I saw a linkedin post that actually made me laugh out loud.
it was from my fellow weirdo, [PERSON] who begged us to embrace our weirdness on this platform.
As someone who has been active on linkedin for [ENTITY], this post resonated with me deeply.
I decided to embrace my weirdness and the results I saw were crazy.
I shot jillian a dm and we got on a call.
I told her it's time to build something for the weirdos of linkedin.
I knew the combination of my newsletter skills (shoutout beehiiv, the best newsletter platform In the world) with [PERSON]'s content skills were a perfect combination.
so in [ENTITY], I built a fully functioning newsletter, a beautiful website, and we were off to the races.
we low-key even got a mention from [ORG] in their newsletter [ENTITY] (mama, I made it).
[ENTITY] is [ENTITY] we are officially launching [ORG].
A newsletter/global revolution that is here to:
Teach you how to break through your blocks and get weird online
[ORG] your posts by learning from the content that‚Äôs blowing up
Create a community of people who are done being professional robots, and want to hold hands and be real together online
join the fun here - [LINK]
tag a friend of yours that belongs on this side of the algorithm and while you're at it drop a solid meme.
See you on the other side brave pioneers. ü§ù

when we witness something extraordinary, we should share it right?
i absolutely love this video of a dog shredding on a skateboard like a canine [PERSON]. many of us go through life hoping to see something that genuinely surprises us. This little [ENTITY]-legged daredevil delivered that in spades.
i'm not even a "dog person" or particularly into skateboarding, but excellence transcends preferences, doesn't it?
anyone else think there should be a newsletter dedicated to dogs with remarkable talents? i have a feeling it would find an audience.
pet parents would eat it up for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
of course, only if it's built on beehiiv.

after getting fired [ENTITY], i‚Äôm giving myself [ENTITY] to build a solo-founded, bootstrapped business to [ENTITY].
no fluff. no hiding. just a full-on masterclass in building in public.
whether i crash and burn or actually pull it off, it‚Äôs all gonna be here - live, for the linkedin universe to watch.
i‚Äôm calling it: fired to acquired.
[ENTITY] is [ENTITY], and here‚Äôs what went down:
finished vibe-coding my full front end
hired an engineer to build the mvp (backend + all)
opened my business bank account
booked [ENTITY] meetings with potential launch customers/partners
i can already tell - this is going to be one of the hardest and most rewarding things i‚Äôve ever done.
but the time is now. and i‚Äôm taking my shot.
let‚Äôs go.
[PERSON] ill be documenting my whole journey here, [LINK]

[ENTITY] after being fired, i'm launching my startup to the world.
introducing RallyUp: a platform for companies to create, automate, and track linkedin posting competitions that boost reach, culture, and recruiting.
launching [ENTITY] with [ENTITY] private beta partners (almost at capacity) but room for [ENTITY] more all-star teams.
if you miss out on the [ENTITY] cohort, i'm opening up to [ENTITY] companies for our [ORG] challenge in [ENTITY].
learn more + get your company involved here ‚Üí [LINK]
why now? trust for brands is at an all-time low. companies investing in employee-led growth have an unfair competitive advantage.
‚Ä¢ [ENTITY] of people trust employee posts over branded ones ‚Ä¢ employee content drives [ENTITY] more engagement than brand content ‚Ä¢ [ENTITY] of job seekers research employers on social media
and guess what? it costs a fraction of other marketing costs. early teams get my hands-on expertise guiding them through the process.
i've never been more bullish on linkedin. it's not cringe anymore, it's a goldmine for companies.
now why me?
i saw employee-led growth work magic at both ramp and beehiiv ([ENTITY] companies crushing this strategy).
in [ENTITY] i've generated [ENTITY] impressions. so i know a bit about how this works.
i also launched my very own linkedin [ENTITY] challenge with people all over the world posting consistently on linkedin. everyday in our groupchat there are more and more wins.
lastly, i just got fired and am now all in.
now friends and strangers of linkedin, please do me a solid.
so i can prove to my father-in-law that entrepreneur doesn't mean unemployed, comment a company/team/person that would benefit from this üëá
all gas. no breaks. hashtag#firedtoacquired stay building, alec

i just raised a pre-seed round for [ORG] and i'm hiring.
here's how i went from fired to funded in [ENTITY].
for those following the journey: [ENTITY] i was let go from beehiiv. instead of hunting for a job, i decided to bet on myself.
i was planning on bootstrapping, starting with a services model and some early revenue.
then something unexpected happened...
RallyUp resonated way harder than i anticipated. teams actually got excited about turning employees into their best marketing channel. startups and fortune [PRODUCT] started reaching out asking when they could sign up.
when [PERSON] from [ORG] reached out saying he saw the [ENTITY] opportunity too, i knew it was time to move faster.
[PERSON] is incredibly bright and strategic, and i couldn‚Äôt be more excited to partner with him. [ORG] has a strong track record of picking winners, having invested early in companies like [ORG], Expel, and more.
and now for everyone keeping score at home... raising money isn't the goal. building an incredible product that delivers real value is.
and to do that even faster, i'm hiring an all-star engineer.
not looking for someone who just codes. i need someone who will:
shape the product roadmap alongside me
bring their own ideas and vision to the table
think about customers and the business, not just the code
ideally someone passionate about social media
we're offering: üí∞ competitive salary üìà strong equity package üè† [ENTITY] remote + great benefits [ENTITY]Ô∏è unlimited pto [PRODUCT] rare chance to get in at the ground level
application link is in the comments, please tag the perfect person for this role below üëá
ps: also looking for a cracked creative gtm pro who knows how to reach b2b buyers without making them want to delete your emails. open to fractional or agency setups.
all gas no brakes. this is only the beginning. thank you G-d!

sometimes when we are down, all we need is a little push from our friends to get us back on track.
we all experience that initial rush of motivation when starting something new, then suddenly... flatline. the inspiration evaporates and we're stuck upside down, legs flailing.
this is where most people bail, but the successful ones? they push through that dip.
i've been watching this play out in real time with our [LOCATION] 50 day posting challenge (hunger games). we're [ENTITY] in, and for most of the [ENTITY] participants, the honeymoon phase is over.
these next few weeks separate the consistent from the quitters.
that's why community matters so much. when motivation fades, having people who flip you right-side up makes all the difference.
sometimes all we need is that little push from someone who sees us struggling.
community, baby. it's the difference between turtle success and turtle failure.
